What have your premeds been?
Posts.Title: Gemzar/Carboplatin cenri76 DancingVeggie

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2014 09:51PM DancingVeggie wrote: Hello, all.  After my second treatment in my first round last Wednesday, I spent the weekend in the hospital with a neutropenic fever. I was discharged after two nights and when I went in yesterday to see the onc and have labs, I was called back in because my counts were still too low.  I was prescribed daily Neupogen shots -- three days in total -- to get a boost on this week off.  My sacrum is SCREAMING but I am sure that's a good thing.  Teeth hurt, too.   Flimsical: Yes, I have EMLA cream for my port, thank goodness.  I forgot to put it on before I went to the ER Friday night.  NEVER AGAIN.  The shot I was given the other day during treatment was Xgeva, but the nurse didn't tell me what it was, only that it was a "bone shot".  I seriously wish there was some kind of patient aptitude rating so doctors and nurses know to whom they can give actual medical information and not babytalk nonsense.  I'll never forget the plastic surgeon who kept calling Alloderm "human leather".  Dude.  I'm a big girl; just tell me what it is.  Crabby today.  Full moon is coming. Hair started coming out in handfuls and my head is itching, so I gave myself a crewcut today. <sigh>
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2014 03:48AM DancingVeggie wrote: I just completed my second cycle and I feel terrible. Non-stop low grade fevers that make me feel yucky, queasy tummy, and bone pain. I am always uncomfortably full when I do actually eat, but I'm still gaining weight, it seems.  I thought I was feeling slimmer but the scale says otherwise.  I cried myself to sleep today after brunch.  This stuff is making me really sad.  My little boys are off camp this week and I am worried that I feel so bad and won't want to take them anywhere. Tylenol and Advil seem useless.
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Or maybe the nurse who gave it to me is a BRUTE. She rammed my port access in so hard and it was so tough to yank out that I am still sore from that, too. :(

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2014 10:36PM DancingVeggie wrote: Had another treatment and my fever has been between 99.7 and 100.4 for two and a half hours despite taking acetaminophen. Further, I've had diarrhea all day and sores around my anus. ER or no?
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2014 04:06AM - edited Aug 10, 2014 04:06AM by DancingVeggie After each of my two cycles of Halaven, I ended up in the hospital with fever; the first time, I had neutropenia, and the second time, I had high white blood cell count.  No one knows for sure why I had a fever (topped out at 101.1) but they guessed that it was the Neulasta. I have since had continuous low grade fevers (99.5) and I can totally feel my liver mets from the inside and the outside.  If I don't take two ibuprofen a day, I am miserable.  I took an extra week off to take my son to Camp Kesem (if you have children, you should check out this free camp for children of parents with cancer) and I have scheduled scans for this Monday.  I think I'll be asking for Abraxane.  I don't want to deal with steroid face if I can help it.   Peace out (most likely).
